docs.title: RAG Notes
docs.text: A place to write notes using simple text files.

docs.title: What is this?
docs.text: This is a website made from text files. You write notes in simple text format (called Markdown), and it turns into a pretty website automatically.

docs.title: Why use this?
docs.text:
• Free - No cost to host your notes online
  • Simple - Just write text, no coding needed
  • Shareable - Anyone can view your notes with a link
  • Dark mode - Easy on the eyes at night

docs.title: How to start?
docs.text: Click on How To Setup Your Own Notes in the menu to create your own notes site step by step.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Create your own notes website from scratch. No experience needed.

docs.title: Step 1: Open Terminal
docs.text:
On Mac:

  1. Press Cmd + Space to open Spotlight
  2. Type Terminal
  3. Press Enter

A black window will open. This is where you type commands.

docs.title: Step 2: Create a projects folder (optional)
docs.text:
If you want to keep your projects organized:

mkdir -p ~/RAGprojects
cd ~/RAGprojects

docs.title: Step 3: Create your project
docs.text:
uv init rag-notes --no-package

This creates a new folder called rag-notes with your project inside.

docs.title: Step 4: Go into that folder
docs.text:
cd rag-notes

You're now in: ~/RAGprojects/rag-notes

docs.title: Step 5: Install the website tools
docs.text:
uv add mkdocs mkdocs-material

Wait for it to finish. This downloads the tools you need.

docs.title: Step 6: Create the docs folder
docs.text:
uv run mkdocs new .

This creates a docs folder. Your notes go in here.

docs.title: Step 7: Start your website
docs.text: uv run mkdocs serve --livereload

docs.title: Step 8: See your website
docs.text:
1. Open your web browser (Chrome, Safari, etc.)
  2. Go to: http://127.0.0.1:8000
  3. You'll see your website!

To stop the website: Go back to Terminal and press Ctrl + C

docs.title: What's next?
docs.text: Your website only works on your computer right now. To put it online so others can see it, go to Upload to GitHub.

docs.title: Deploy to GitHub Pages
docs.text: Turn your notes into a real website that anyone can visit. It's free!

docs.title: Step 1: Deploy your site
docs.text:
Run this one command:

uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

That's it! Wait 2-3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2: Visit your website
docs.text:
Your website is now live at:

https://YOUR-USERNAME.github.io/my-notes/

Replace YOUR-USERNAME with your GitHub username.

docs.title: How to update your website
docs.text:
After making changes to your notes:

git add .
git commit -m "Updated notes"
git push
uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

Your website will update in a few minutes.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
You now have:

  1. A notes folder - Write text files in the docs folder
  2. A backup on GitHub - Your files are saved online
  3. A live website - Anyone can read your notes

Just write, save, and deploy. That's all there is to it!

docs.title: Upload to GitHub
docs.text: GitHub is a website that stores your files online for free. We'll put your notes there.

docs.title: Step 1: Save your work
docs.text:
First, save all your files:

git add .

Then create a save point (called a "commit"):

git commit -m "My first save"

docs.title: Step 2: Create a GitHub repository
docs.text:
This command does everything for you - creates a place on GitHub and uploads your files:

gh repo create my-notes --source=. --remote=origin --push --public

Want it private? Change --public to --private

docs.title: Step 3: Check it worked
docs.text:
git remote -v

You should see a GitHub URL. Your files are now on GitHub!

docs.title: How to save future changes
docs.text:
Whenever you update your notes, run these commands:

git add .
git commit -m "Updated my notes"
git push

That's it! Your changes are saved online.

docs.title: What's next?
docs.text: Your files are on GitHub. Now let's make them into a live website - go to Deploy to GitHub Pages.
